content.description: This line is the first climb I found in this area, when I climbed it I was surprised to find anchors at the top. Climbs through some easy shelves and then works through a shallow hand crack to the anchors.
content.location: From where you approach the cliff band head southeast (right) along the wal, passing the meadow and through some overgrowth the trail will come back into the wall. The climb begins with some horizontal plates below a left facing flake.

content.description: In a Rock house there is an obvious right facing hand crack that passes a single bolt to a flaring off-width
content.location: From the approach trail this will be the rock shelter and the first climb around the corner to the left.

content.description: This large detached flake though a little bit hollow sounding in spots it’s an awesome line. Bring your 4’s, 5’s, & 6’s for this one. The bottom half is defiantly harder than the top. To descend top out and carefully crawl across the small ledge below a roof to the other side. There is a cordelette to lower from (watch out for loose rock while traversing the ledge)
content.location: From the aproch trail go left about 200 yards

content.description: A large intimidating chimney, but don't let the size if the void fool you there is actually good gear all the way to the top. no excessively large gear required
content.protection: Small to medium gear. Nothing bugger than a #4
content.location: From the point at Longfield Branch travel to the southeast along the cliff for apox 150 yards until you see the freestanding pillar, climb starts to the left of the pillar and finishes on the main wall.

content.description: A fun Right facing dihedral that ends through some interesting moves after the finger crack disappears.
content.location: Directly to the left of Mixed DNA (use the cordelette for Mixed DNA to descend)

content.description: A Fun and interesting corner that leads up to a fist sized corner. The bottom of the line is very well protected but the middle section has no gear just a big chicken head located about 5’ below the fist sized corner. The upper corner takes wide gear a #5 is helpful.
content.location: This climb is on the West side of Longfield branch. From the Approach trail walk north along the wall, passing an obvious Off-width flake the climb will be just ahead starting behind a large detached boulder

content.description: A often wet but surprisingly good hand/fist crack. Follow to the ledge or take it all the way to the top with some wide gear.
content.location: This route is located on the east side of longfield branch just to the left of a large detached pillar

content.description: The closest climbing to the parking area can be found here on this long point and also has a great vantage point of the entire valley. Several established lines can be found here as well as a large amount of unclimbed crack systems.
